class.name: Word.CommentReply
class.description: Represents a comment reply in the document.

examples.description: Replies to the first active comment in the selected content.

properties.name: authorEmail
properties.description: Gets the email of the comment reply's author.

examples.description: Get and display the email address of the author who wrote the first reply to the first comment in the document.

properties.name: authorName
properties.description: Gets the name of the comment reply's author.

examples.description: Get and display the author name of the first reply to the first comment in the document.

properties.name: content
properties.description: Specifies the comment reply's content. The string is plain text.

examples.description: Update the content of the first reply to the first comment in the document to say "I agree with this suggestion"
Highlight the content range of the first reply in the first comment by applying a yellow background color to make it stand out.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a comment reply to load and read its content property, demonstrating how the context connects the add-in to the Office host application.

properties.name: creationDate
properties.description: Gets the creation date of the comment reply.

examples.description: Display the creation date of the first reply to the first comment in the document

properties.name: id
properties.description: Gets the ID of the comment reply.

examples.description: Get and display the ID of the first reply to the first comment in the document

properties.name: parentComment
properties.description: Gets the parent comment of this reply.

examples.description: Get the parent comment of a reply and display its content in the console.
Delete the first reply from the first comment in the document

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call `context.sync()` before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: `propertyNamesAndPaths.select` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and `propertyNamesAndPaths.expand` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Load and display the content and author name of the first reply to the first comment in the document.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

examples.description: Update multiple properties of an existing comment reply, setting both its content text and marking it as resolved

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript `toJSON()` method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to `JSON.stringify()`. (`JSON.stringify`, in turn, calls the `toJSON` method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original `Word.CommentReply` object is an API object, the `toJSON` method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as `Word.Interfaces.CommentReplyData`) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Serialize a comment reply to JSON format for logging or data export purposes

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across `.sync` calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track a comment reply object to maintain its reference across multiple sync calls when modifying its properties in separate operations.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call `context.sync()` before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Reply to a comment, then untrack the reply object to free up memory after the operation is complete.
